intro: Crupinastrum, commonly known as sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky bracts that surround the small, composite flowers. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Crupinastrum species often have succulent leaves and stems, which help them retain moisture in arid or salty climates. The flowers are usually blue or purple, adding a vibrant touch to the landscape where they grow.
